cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code iterates through the 'ptr->views' array using 'ptr->num_views' as the upper bound. If 'ptr->num_views' is an untrusted value that exceeds the actual allocated size of the 'ptr->views' array, an out-of-bounds read will occur when accessing 'ptr->views[i]'. This can lead to a crash (Denial of Service) or potentially information disclosure if the out-of-bounds memory contains sensitive data.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended input buffer.
explanation: The code iterates through ptr->views using ptr->num_views as the loop bound. If ptr->num_views is larger than the actual allocated size of the ptr->views array, an out-of-bounds read will occur when accessing ptr->views[i]. This can lead to crashes, information leakage, or potentially arbitrary code execution. The code does not perform any bounds checking to ensure ptr->num_views is within the allocated limits of ptr->views.
